MS MCQs

    Work with XMLports in Dynamics 365 Business Central

    »

    1. In an import XMLport, if the AutoSave property is set to false and the AutoUpdate property is set to true, what does the XMLport do with the records from the external file?

      The XMLport only reads the records from the file, automatically inserts them, and automatically updates or replaces data in the database.

      The XMLport only reads the records from the file, but does not automatically insert them, and does not automatically update or replace data in the database.

      The XMLport only reads the records from the file, but does not automatically insert them, but will automatically update or replace data in the database.

      The XMLport only reads the records from the file, automatically inserts them, but does not automatically update or replace data in the database.


    2. When must the Width property of an XMLport node be used?

      You must use this property when the Format property of the XMLport is set to VariableText.

      You must use this property when the Format property of the XMLport is set to FixedText.

      It must be used if any Format property of the XMLport is selected.

      You must use this property when the Format property of the XMLport is set to Integer.


    3. When you export, which XMLport format lines up the information in columns?

      FixedText

      VariableText

      XML

      All text formats


    4. When you export, which XMLport format creates the smallest possible file?

      XML

      Variable text

      Fixed text

      All text


    5. What is the purpose of the Direction property in the XMLport?

      It specifies whether an XMLport can be used for import.

      It specifies whether an XMLport can be used for export.

      It specifies whether an XMLport can be used to direct a statement implementation.

      It specifies whether an XMLport can be used for import, export, or both.
